summary: Another realistic ENB. This one focus on immersion and realism while maintaining playability. No pitch black nights and dungeons.
descriptionHtml:
[img] http://s8.postimage.org/x9znsdt05/fantastic_ENB.jpg[/img]
v 1.3 Comming Soon!



[b]First of, If you are looking for a colorful, high contrast, \"Michael Bay\" kind of ENB, this one is probably not for you. :-)[/b]

[color=red]Please download http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0130.htm to use with this one. [/color]

There are 3 different files to download, high, medium and low. Low gives best performance, medium is balanced, high looks the best. :-)

[b]This ENB should now be somewhat compatible with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17802] Climates of Tamriel[/url]. There will be a special version just for Climates of Tamriel in the future.[/b]

This ENB is best used with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043] Enhanced Lights and FX[/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/1627949]anamorfus[/url]

[color=Yellow][b] Feel free to submit screenshots from your game using this ENB. Or drop a comment and let me know what you think of it. [/color][/b]

There are so many beautiful ENB presets out there, and maybe you have tried some of them already. 
If so, you have probably spent hours trying to tweak your ENB to get rid of that thing that just ruins the whole experience. These are some of the problems I\'ve encountered and tried to get rid of:

- Unplayable dark nights & dungeons
- Days seem overexposed
- Too big difference between light and shadowed areas
- Too washed out contrast and colors
- Water is \"bright\" during night
- Horizon seems out of place compared to the sky ( too bright/dark )
- Colors are too cartoony
- Interiors gives a different \"feel\" to exterior.
- SSAO looks wierd in foggy situations.


[b][u]INSTALLATION[/b][/u]
-Download the file from the link provided in [color=red]red text[/color] above.
-Extract the file anywhere, and copy the content of \"Wrapperversion\" to your Skyrim main folder.
-Download one of the \"Tolerable ENB\" files.
-Extract to your skyrim folder, replace all files when prompted.
-Enjoy :-) 

( Remember to set \"bFloatPointRenderTarget=1\" in \"SkyrimPrefs.ini\" or ENB won\'t work. )


Credit goes to:
[url=http://www.enbdev.com/] ENB[/url] by Boris Vorontsov

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26053]BETTER THAN REAL[/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/1005590]CandyRay[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6113]InjFX[/url] by some_dude
author: majk360
